name: B'nai B'rith International
goal:
B’nai B’rith International has advocated for global Jewry and championed the cause of human rights since 1843. Now in our 175th year, B’nai B’rith is recognized as a vital voice in promoting Jewish unity and continuity, a leader in disaster relief, a tireless advocate on behalf of senior citizens and a staunch defender of the State of Israel. With a presence in more than 50 countries, B’nai B’rith is the Global Voice of the Jewish Community.
Through its office in Brussels Bnai Brith International is closely cooperating with EU institutions, governments and other Jewish Organisations in promoting and defending human rights and the fight against anti-Semitism, racism, and xenophobia in Europe.
interests: Culture, Education and training, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Humanitarian aid and civil protection, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Sport, Youth
euInitiatives:
B'nai B'rith has delegations at the European Parliament and the Council of Europe in Strasbourg.

The main goals of B'nai B'rith in Europe are the defense of human rights and the fight against anti-Semitism, racism, and xenophobia. The objectives also include the defense of the State of Israel; humanitarian relief for the needy in Eastern Europe and in Israel; and the development of Jewish identity, culture, and heritage.

We are closely following the work of the European Parliament and its relevant committees, such as the committee for Foreign Affairs AFET, the Civil Liberties, Justice and Home Affairs LIBE, the Human Rights DROI as well as the Delegation for Relations with Israel

B'nai B'rith is part of the advisory board to the informal working group against anti-Semitism in the European Parliament

B'nai B'rith is meeting and consulting on a regular basis with MEPs, members of the Commission and Council on issues such as combatting anti-Semitism, Holocaust restitution and other issues concerning European Jewry
